title: US bars former Haitian prime minister from entering the country
description: The sanction is the latest in a string of actions the US has taken to confront corruption in the Caribbean country.

title: World Bank’s new chief asks staff to ‘double down’ on development
description: Ajay Banga told employees his vision was 'to create a world free from poverty on a livable planet'.

title: Canada wildfires spread to new areas, prompting more evacuations
description: About 10,000 people have been ordered to leave a city in Quebec, amid hundreds of fires burning across the country.

title: Ecuador’s embattled President Lasso will not seek re-election
description: Guillermo Lasso's announcement comes weeks after he dissolved the legislature amid prospect of impeachment.

title: Pakistani rights lawyer says he has returned home after abduction
description: Rights groups say recent rash of abductions in Pakistan may be forced disappearances at the hands of the secret service.

title: Why has the conviction of Senegal’s Sonko sparked such anger?
description: Ousmane Sonko says charges are politically motivated to stop him challenging President Macky Sall in 2024 election.

title: US telecom stocks hit as Amazon in talks for cellphone services
description: The online retail giant's entry could cause major disruptions in US telecom which has some of highest charges globally.

title: Blinken to visit Saudi Arabia to discuss ‘strategic cooperation’
description: The trip next week will be the top US diplomat's first to the kingdom since the Iranian-Saudi normalisation deal.

title: Netflix, Disney, Amazon to challenge India tobacco rules: Report
description: Streaming firms are exploring ways to stall new tobacco warning rules that will need them to edit millions of hours.

title: US court sentences Haitian businessman to life in Moise’s killing
description: Rodolphe Jaar is one of 11 people arrested and charged in US for alleged involvement in Haitian president's killing.

title: US investigators end probe into former VP Pence classified docs
description: The lack of charges in the probe removes one headache for Pence before his anticipated presidential campaign launch.

title: India’s PM Narendra Modi to address US Congress
description: Leaders from both major US political parties say speech will be opportunity to speak to shared 'global challenges'.

title: Canadian city where Muslim family killed gets funds to fight hate
description: Advocates greet funding for anti-Islamophobia education campaign in London, Ontario, as 'step towards positive change'.

title: Many people feared dead after train derails in eastern India

title: US, UN slam arrest of prominent Vietnamese environmental activist

title: Iran releases one Danish and two Austrian citizens
description: Austrian Foreign Minister Alexander Schallenberg 'very relieved' that Kamran Ghaderi and Massud Mossaheb freed.

title: UEFA charge Mourinho for referee abuse after Europa League final

title: Fort Liberty: US army base Fort Bragg drops Confederate namesake
description: Change comes as US continues to grapple with prevalence of statues and sites honouring members of Confederacy.

title: Asia security summit begins amid US-China tensions
description: The Shangri-La Dialogue attracts military officers, diplomats, arms makers and security analysts from around the globe.

title: Dev Shah wins US National Spelling Bee with ‘psammophile’
description: Shah beats out 230 competitors aged 9-14 to win annual competition and take home $50,000 prize.

title: ‘Stop sending weapons, hold talks’ to end Russia-Ukraine war
description: China's envoy says in order to achieve peace, Kyiv's allies must 'stop sending weapons to the battlefield'.

description: Parvez Elahi arrested over corruption charges as PTI chief Imran Khan threatens to sue gov't agency that arrested him.

title: Prince Harry expected to give evidence in a London court
description: He and more than 100 other high-profile figures have brought a lawsuit against Mirror Group Newspapers.

title: A ‘Russian love affair’: Why South Africa stays ‘neutral’ on war
description: South Africa's stance of neutrality in the Russia-Ukraine war has been at variance with its Moscow ties. Why is that so?

title: Tax the wealthiest to avoid IMF, says Tunisia’s president
description: Tunisia's president is looking for ways to avoid a bailout package worth nearly $2bn that hinges upon reform.

title: Palestinian toddler seriously wounded by Israeli fire
description: Young boy is in critical condition after being shot in occupied West Bank incident that also injured his father.

title: Why ‘white’ supremacists are not always white
description: Black and brown men committing white supremacist crimes in America should not surprise anyone.

title: A post-pandemic homage to Catalonia
description: Barcelona, for me, represented an illusion of permanence - until it was fully undone by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: What’s the latest in Sudan? Suspended talks, sanctions, fighting

description: Palestinian liberation is, at its core, a leftist struggle.

description: Supporters of opposition figure denounce charges, sentence as a ploy to prevent him from running in elections.

title: Japan’s birth rate drops to fresh record low
description: Latest figures released by health ministry show birth rate has dropped below previous low of 2005.

title: UN says organised crime shifting drugs routes in Southeast Asia

title: US cuts data sharing with Russia under New START nuclear deal

title: Deal to raise debt ceiling passes US Senate, heads to Biden

title: Russia says US intelligence hacked thousands of iPhones

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 464

title: Treason trial of Russian hypersonic missile scientist begins
description: Anatoly Maslov is one of three scientists involved in Russia's hypersonic missile programme that are standing trial.
